title: Museum of Tarot - B·∫£o T√†ng Tarot
address: 44 ƒê. Nguy·ªÖn Khuy·∫øn, T√¢n An, Ninh Ki·ªÅu, C·∫ßn Th∆° 900000

reviews.name: Andrea Ghannadian
reviews.review: This is an extensive collection with fascinating pieces. It‚Äôs a very tiny place on 3 floors (Vietnam-style)  with interesting things in every corner. Owners were very nice.  The attached coffee shop was having renovations done, but they let us in anyway.

reviews.name: IntrepidTeach
reviews.review: More of a coffee shop with dusty, cramped, poorly lit exhibits. There's an upstairs with additional exhibits for a hefty price. However, if you agree to give a 5 star review, you can see it for FREE! Don't trust those reviews.

reviews.name: Chuan Lee
reviews.review: How can this place deserve so many good reviews? Overrated and is a very bad place.

reviews.name: Ryan O'Hare
reviews.review: Very informative visit and very helpful owner. He went above and beyond to make sure we got to see the museum even though they were carrying out renovations. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.name: Thea Boyer
reviews.review: Fun visit to Tarot Museum. So much to see and take in during our tour of several floors. Quite a collection!

reviews.name: Carlos Perez Pinaud
reviews.review:
It is an absolute delight to listen to the owner of the museum, who personally does a very informative tour of the whole place. You can clearly see that he is passionate about what he is talking about.
The collection of Tarot cards (as well as other cards, stones, and even amulets) is astonishing and ever-growing.
This is truly a hidden gem of Can Tho.

reviews.name: Bubuila Promulgitu
reviews.review:
Just many tarot cards, literature and accessories collected and‚Ä¶shown, not displayed is someone‚Äôs house.
We visited around 1 PM and found someone sleeping on the floor at the first level‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..

reviews.name: Hoa Nguyen
reviews.review: Note that the photo from Trip Advisor does not match the front of this museum. I tried to contact someone via the website months in advance and received no reply. Showed up on a Thursday at 1 PM and paid entry fee (after having to get attendant's attention who was busy texting / playing games on his phone), took off shoes and ascended stairs. Displays full of items but unmarked. Skipped the recorded commentary based on poor reviews. Wifii not working. Air was stuffy--ceiling fans were turned off for some reason. Not sure if the cafe was running--no evidence of food/drink service for visitors and none offered. Disappointed that the lithotherapy objects were removed from the collection. As a Viet Kieu who is an avid tarot person, I found myself a bit let down. Three stars for a cool collection of items that photographed well but it all felt a bit neglected and randomly displayed--bummed that they did not offer Vietnamese tarot decks for sale.

reviews.name: Phil Langdon
reviews.review: Great if your vaguely interested in Tarot. Many cards, pictures, book from many countries.  Lot of stones for the stoned enthusiast (lapidary).   Tea & coffee available

reviews.name: Merinda Hewat-Cameron
reviews.review: What a fantastic find! A real jewel in the city of Can Tho. A lovely young man, Will was my tour guide! There are 3 floors of artifacts & historical items. Such a lovely surprise and I thoroughly enjoyed it! I‚Äôm so pleased I visited and do stay afterwards to have the most amazing aromatic coffee! I wish to highly recommend a visit to the Museum of Tarot! üîÆü™Ñüßô‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

reviews.name: Javier Rodriguez
reviews.review: Not really a museum. Just an extensive collection with no context. The 95k entrance fee is steep for what this is

reviews.name: spoorthi hegde
reviews.review: No one was present for an actual tour in person so chose the audio guide(The owner lives in Hanoi) ..Do NOT go for the audio guide (195k vnd) tour...I wanted to go through the entire museum so went for that option...but robotic voice narration (the price is not justified) and it's missing links in so many places...there was a volunteer who spoke English when I came but left soon (just prompted me to move on to the next file when I pointed out the missing link)...then when I started finding multiple missing links for the audio files, the local guy asked me to wait for 2 hours in order to resolve the issue and gave no refund..Waste of money and time!

reviews.name: Michael (carrollosaka)
reviews.review: What an astonishing place! It‚Äôs closed for renovations at the moment, but Dr Ngo kindly showed me around anyway. There is a huge collection of tarot cards from all around the world, and covering the whole history of tarot from the mid-18th century up to today. Dr Ngo, who teaches comparative religions and beliefs at the university here, had me riveted by his explanation of the history of tarot, and its connections with art and religions in the last 200 years. I highly recommend it, together with the very pleasant coffee shop on the ground floor.

reviews.name: Thugdual Frecer
reviews.review:
Pretty place but the explanations were not useful at all. We don‚Äôt know much about tarot and we still don‚Äôt know a lot after the visit. The price is expensive for what is it. It‚Äôs 200k vnd per person and they give you a guide that is not good at all. The guide is a website on your cellphone, pretty hard to use and it just give you some date about when this kind of tarot was made and what pictures are on it. The price include a drink that is a small bottle of water and a ‚Äúgift‚Äù that was a used vampire tarot pack...
Definitely not worth it. The place has some potential but I didn‚Äôt like it the way they make a visit.

reviews.name: Daniel Fr√∂se
reviews.review: Well let's say it's a private collection which is presented alike , in glass boxes . Audioguide is a website . Nowhere mentioned that you have to bring your phone with headphones. Entrance fee is 200k VCD , which is far to high . In Vietnam the amount for 4 good dinner .

reviews.name: Ben Pate
reviews.review: Awesome spot. The guide is incredibly knowledgable with a PhD from France in the field. He is very fluent in English and his french perfect. Fascinating stories, collection and artifacts. Way more than just Tarot.

reviews.name: Question Colour
reviews.review: The museum tour was a great experience, the collection is unbelievable! The owners (guide) knowledge of the history regarding cards, tarot and magic is very broad and detailed. I highly recommend visiting! :)

reviews.name: Jason Shin
reviews.review: The reason it got two star is that it is closed in spite of the opening hours posted.  I visited there but they said it is closed for the morning and will open in the afternoon.  Disappointed!  Check before if you happen to visit on Sunday.

reviews.name: Jonathan Waldie
reviews.review: The Museum of Tarot was awesome. It has very well currated items by Dr. Philippe NGO who really knows his stuff and gives an amazing guided tour. Everything is well laid out so that Dr. NGO can walk you through the history of the cards for both ludic/paidic purposes as well as the more mystical side. The tour focuses mainly on the history of the mystic, looking at it from all different cultural and religious view points. Finally, it extends beyond the tarot to a many more relics. Amazing tour in a beautifully restored building. Dr. NGO is knowledgeable and respectful of the history and culture. This museum is a must if you are in the city even for a short amount of time. Be sure to email a bit ahead of time to arrange for your visit.

reviews.name: Long Phan
reviews.review: perfect place for everyone who loves Tarot and Magical items. Staffs are friendly and Manager is wisdom. I had the most interesting conversation in my life.

reviews.name: Adriana Reina
reviews.review: It was closed during the time it is suposed to be open. Then I called and we arrange a meeting hour, but the staff never came.

reviews.name: Long Phan
reviews.review: Perfect place. The manager is super knowledge. I had  learnt many thing from him.
